derivation: from G1909 (ἐπίσκοπος) and G4649 (ἐπίσκοπος) (in the sense of G1983 (ἐπίσκοπος));
strongs_def: a superintendent, i.e. Christian officer in genitive case charge of a (or the) church (literally or figuratively)
outline:
1. an overseer
    1. a man charged with the duty of seeing that things to be done by others are done rightly, any curator, guardian or superintendent
    2. the superintendent, elder, or overseer of a Christian church
